Module Stratego
Package com.stratego

Class Game

java.lang.Object
com.stratego.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
An model used to hold two Players and a Board, representing and managing all relevant data used in the game.
Author:
Clint Mooney

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Board board
    Represents the game board which contains all pieces placed during the game.
    (package private) Player player1
    Represents the player who goes first in the game.
    (package private) Player player2
    Represents the player who goes second in the game.
    (package private) int whoseTurn
    Represents the current player who is able to make a move or set up pieces.
    (package private) boolean win
    Indicates whether a person has won the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Game​(Player player1, Player player2)
    Creates a game with the two provided Players and generates an empty Board.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Piece checkEncounter​(Piece atkPiece, Piece defPiece)
    Compares two pieces and returns the winning piece.
    Board getBoard()
    Returns board
    Player getCurrentPlayer()
    Gets the player whose turn it currently is.
    Player getPlayer​(int playerNumber)
    Returns the Player specified.
    int getWhoseTurn()
    Represents the current player who is able to make a move or set up pieces.
    boolean getWinStatus()
    Indicates whether a person has won the game.
    void shuffle()
    Places pieces on the board in a random manner for the Player specified by whoseTurn.
    void switchTurn()
    Toggles whoseTurn to either 1 or 2 to denote whose turn it currently is.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns board
      Returns:
      board

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer​(int playerNumber)
      Returns the Player specified. A value of 1 returns player1. A value of 2 returns player2. Otherwise, this returns null.
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - specifies which Player to return.
      Returns:
      the Player specified by playerNumber.

    • getWinStatus

      public boolean getWinStatus()
      Indicates whether a person has won the game.
      Returns:
      win.

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Places pieces on the board in a random manner for the Player specified by whoseTurn.

    • checkEncounter

      public Piece checkEncounter​(Piece atkPiece, Piece defPiece)
      Compares two pieces and returns the winning piece. For the majority of pieces, this is a simple comparison of rank value. However, there are some exceptions. When the two are equal in rank value, a value of null is returned. In the case that the defending piece is a bomb, it wins unless the opposing piece is a miner. In the case the defending piece is a flag, it returns the attacking piece and sets win to true.
      Parameters:
      atkPiece - refers to the Piece of the Player that initiated the encounter.
      defPiece - refers to the Piece of the Player that did not initiate the encounter.
      Returns:
      the winning Piece when two Pieces are compared.

    • switchTurn

      public void switchTurn()
      Toggles whoseTurn to either 1 or 2 to denote whose turn it currently is.

    • getWhoseTurn

      public int getWhoseTurn()
      Represents the current player who is able to make a move or set up pieces.
      Returns:
      whoseTurn

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the player whose turn it currently is.
      Returns:
      the player whose turn corresponds to whoseTurn.
